skillTree.localised_description: Ulther has learnt siege warfare under the tutelage of Belegar Ironhammer and mastered it during his long record of conflict against the Greenskins.

skillTree.localised_description: All Dwarfs are stubborn, but none more so than Grudgebearer, the founder of the Age of Reckoning.

skillTree.localised_description: Ulther’s father, Ulfar Stonehammer, was respected and well-liked by his subjects. He was famous for his compassion towards his kin and his deep hatred for the Dawi-Zharr; Both Ulfar, and Ulther alike his father, would go into a frenzy at the mere sight of them.

skillTree.localised_description: One of the most renowned regiments in the Karaz Ankor, the Dragon Company is comprised of the descendants of proud warriors from Karak Ungor. These Dawi would gladly lay their lives down in their quest to reclaim their lost Hold.

effects.description: Replenishes 25% campaign movement range after winning a battle

No Upkeep for the Dragon Company

skillTree.localised_description: Though the majority of Dawi despise their Chaos-worshipping kin, the Kings of Karak Ungor display an especially deep hatred towards the Dawi-Zharr, to the point where they would see any Dwarf suspected of carrying the taint of Chaos put to death.

skillTree.localised_description: The Dragon Company was a small but formidable force, carefully executing distractionary attacks to separate the enemy into muddled pockets before the main assault. These tactics prove even more devastating now that Ulther commands a larger force.

skillTree.localised_description: Years of constant uphill fighting in the snowy peaks of the World’s Edge Mountains have made Ulther and his warriors exceptionally capable at holding ground even in the face of overwhelming odds.

skillTree.localised_description: After his father’s passing, Ulther became the new head of Clan Durazgrund, or Stonehammer in Reikspiel, and he has dedicated his whole being to the reclamation of Karak Ungor. To this end, support and aid have been pledged to the young prince’s quest from clans of the Karaz Ankor, who thirst for vengeance against the Greenskin despoilers, and even the Men of the Empire, who would like the threat of Greenskins beyond Ostermark removed.

skillTree.localised_description: Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.

effects.description: Armour: +6

skillTree.localised_description: Dwarfs are resolute - once they commit to charging the foe, they put all their strength behind that initial blow.

effects.description: Charge bonus: +15
Charge bonus: +30

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.

effects.description: Melee defence: +6
Melee defence: +12

skillTree.localised_description: The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.

effects.description: Hit points: +7%

skillTree.localised_description: All Dwarfs despise the Greenskins, for the urki and grobi are the prime agents in the Times of Woe.

skillTree.localised_description: From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.

effects.description: Ability: "Foe-Seeker"

skillTree.localised_description: Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10%
Weapon strength: +20%

skillTree.localised_description: This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.

effects.description: Melee attack: +6

skillTree.localised_description: A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.

skillTree.localised_description: Dwarfs are not fast, yet they will soldier on, always moving despite any hazards encountered.

skillTree.localised_description: The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
